result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie M. KREINER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered pleas in Case Files 15 CM 366, 15 CM 462 and 15 CT 279.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-05-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Plea date is set for 09-23-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Parties are in agreement to amend defendant's bond to no assaultive contact with Jesse Born and to remove the no contact with the residence.   Motion granted.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-06-15 at 1:30 p.m. Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, provide an address to the Clerk of Court office in writing within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Jesse Born or the residence of 614B Fremont Street, Kiel, WI.  Court will allow a one time contact with the residence to obtain personal belonging, with the aid of law enforcement.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
